data.title: Get Current Census Data for Mount Morris village, NY
data.meta_description: Need Mount Morris village demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Mount Morris village, NY from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 2,839 people, Mount Morris village is the 698th most populated city in the state of New York out of 1,524 cities. But watch out, Mount Morris village, because Shandaken with 2,830 people and Honeoye Falls with 2,825 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Mount Morris village racial/ethnic groups are White (78.8%) followed by Hispanic (12.9%) and Two or More (5.3%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Mount Morris village households was $59,211. Mount Morris village households made slightly more than Interlaken households ($59,167), Little Valley town households ($59,152), and Hamilton village households ($59,152) . However, 10.3% of Mount Morris village families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Mount Morris village residents is 36.7 years young.
